## Q1






**Q**: Company X has no debt. Its assets will be worth 597 million in one year if the economy is strong, but only 301.8 million if the economy is weak. Both events are equally likely. The market value today of X's assets is 399 million. What is the expected return without leverage (in %)? <input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='0.5' size='4' data-answer='["12.6"]'/>

**Answer:** 12.65 %

___




## Q2





**Q**: Company Y  has 53 million shares outstanding and a market capitalization of 3 billion. It also has 758 million in debt outstanding. The company  has decided to delever the firm by issuing new equity and completely repaying all the outstanding debt. Assume perfect capital markets. How many new shares must the company issue (in millions)? <input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='1' size='5' data-answer='["13.39"]'/>

**Answer**: 13.39 million shares
